location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:155 x 205 mmFormat:1 b&w silver gelatin printCondition:The image is in good condition with minimal fading.Process:Gelatin silver print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This aerial view of the Beni Bu Ali Fort looking southwest on 4 February 1932 by the R.A.F. during a reconnaissance mission in advance of a planned bombardment of Aiqa and Jaalan (Ja‘alān) described in following folios, f. 129-130.The fort is at centre, while a large number of walled enclosures and dwellings extend from lower right to upper left of the image. Large palm plantations, enclosed by walls, can be seen in the distant background at left. Further enclosed plantations can be seen at lower right and upper right corners.The inscriptions in the upper right corner probably refer to camera settings, as well as date and time of capture.Inscriptions:Recto, directly into negative, upper right corner: 203.B.358.P BENI-BU-ALI-FORT 4.2.32-1011 F6" 4000' LOOKING S.W.’Verso, ink stamp: 'ROYAL AIR FORCE OFFICIAL CROWN COPYRIGHT RESERVED U203 Date 18/2/32'; 'FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY'Temporal Context:Prints produced on 18 February 1932. Photographs taken on 4 February 1932, likely at 10.11 am.
